discussion.content:
It's important to understand Flavor Mappings in VRA. 

For Cloud Accounts, this will be the Cloud provider VM sizing, for example Amazon EC2 instances will have a flavor mapping to the instance type, eg t2.micro and so on.

VSphere does not have "t2.micro" so we must instead choose CPU and Memory values. CPU or Memory alone is not correct.

Also, we must remember that the disk size is not part of the Flavor Mapping... disk size is an attribute of the Image (Operating System) Mapping, not the Flavor Mapping!

If we remember this then the question is simple.

Install Salt minion on the managed systems.
Use cloudConfig in VMware Aria Automation to run the following commands on the Linux VMware Aria Templates deployments:
•curl -L https://bootstrap.saltstack.com -o install_salt.sh
•sudo sh install_salt.sh -A <Salt_master_IP_address>
VMware Aria Automation Config manages these deployments.

The curl -L https://bootstrap.saltstack.com -o install_salt.shcommand downloads a script that is used to install Salt minion on the system.
The sudo sh install_salt.sh -A <Salt_master_IP_address> command runs the script to install Salt minion on the system and specify the Salt master IP address.
VMware Aria Automation Config manages a minion with the saltmaster minion ID. VMware Aria Automation Config runs as Salt master and Salt minion simultaneously.

Taken from Aria Automation ICM 8.10 Lesson Book -> Salt Minion Installation

discussion.content:
How to access the Marketplace:
In vRealize Automation Cloud Assembly, select Infrastructure > Connections > Integrations. Click Add Integration, click My VMware, and provide your My VMware account credentials.
Ref: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.3/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-7D30EA8A-3CF7-4FB5-ADDC-59F46D3E0136.html
also, the question is about integration. So the correct answer is C.

choices.D: Add a new capability tag to the vCenter Server cloud account.
choices.C: Make sure the correct NSX endpoint is selected for the vCenter Server cloud account.
choices.A: Validate the vCenter Server cloud account credentials.
choices.B: Check to make sure image synchronization is successful for the vCenter Server cloud account.

discussion.content:
I think B is correct: 

A. Validate the vCenter Server cloud account credentials. - The templates couldn't have been added without this, so this is wrong
B. Check to make sure image synchronization is successful for the vCenter Server cloud account. - Yes, while the sync is usually quite fast, if it didn't happen the templates won't be seen.
C. Make sure the correct NSX endpoint is selected for the vCenter Server cloud account. - NSX endpoints have nothing to do with VSphere templates
D. Add a new capability tag to the vCenter Server cloud account. - This is not the correct process to do an image mapping
